subject: Physical Fitness
title: Slow-Twitch vs Fast-Twitch
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Slow-Twitch vs Fast-Twitch.

hook.text: A marathon runner and a sprinter train differently, look different, and perform differently. Why?

buildup.text: Muscles contain two main fiber types: slow-twitch (Type I) and fast-twitch (Type II).

discovery.text: Slow-twitch fibers resist fatigue and burn fat. Fast-twitch fibers produce explosive power but tire fast.

twist.text: You can't fully convert one type to the other. Genetics set the ratio; training shifts it slightly.

climax.text: Elite marathoners are 80%+ slow-twitch. Elite sprinters are 80%+ fast-twitch. Both are born, then made.

punchline.text: Your fiber mix is your starting hand. Training plays it.
